idAbs.para: Returns the properties of a raster dataset.

summary.para: Returns the properties of a raster dataset.

pythonReference.para: The property to be obtained from the raster dataset.

bulletList.bullet_item: MINIMUM—Returns the smallest value of all cells in the input raster.
MAXIMUM—Returns the largest value of all cells in the input raster.
MEAN—Returns the average of all cells in the input raster.
STD—Returns the standard deviation of all cells in the input raster.
UNIQUEVALUECOUNT—Returns the number of unique values in the input raster.
TOP—Returns the top or YMax value of the extent.
LEFT—Returns the left or XMin value of the extent.
RIGHT—Returns the right or XMax value of the extent.
BOTTOM—Returns the bottom or YMin value of the extent.
CELLSIZEX—Returns the cell size in the x-direction.
CELLSIZEY—Returns the cell size in the y-direction.

VALUETYPE—Returns the type of the cell value in the input raster: 0 = 1-bit1 = 2-bit2 = 4-bit3 = 8-bit unsigned integer4 = 8-bit signed integer5 = 16-bit unsigned integer6 = 16-bit signed integer7 = 32-bit unsigned integer8 = 32-bit signed integer9 = 32-bit floating point10 = 64-bit double precision11 = 8-bit complex12 = 64-bit complex13 = 16-bit complex 14 = 32-bit complex
COLUMNCOUNT—Returns the number of columns in the input raster.
ROWCOUNT—Returns the number of rows in the input raster.
BANDCOUNT—Returns the number of bands in the input raster.

dialogReference.para: The property to be obtained from the raster dataset.

bulletList.bullet_item: MINIMUM—Returns the smallest value of all cells in the input raster.
MAXIMUM—Returns the largest value of all cells in the input raster.
MEAN—Returns the average of all cells in the input raster.
STD—Returns the standard deviation of all cells in the input raster.
UNIQUEVALUECOUNT—Returns the number of unique values in the input raster.
TOP—Returns the top or YMax value of the extent.
LEFT—Returns the left or XMin value of the extent.
RIGHT—Returns the right or XMax value of the extent.
BOTTOM—Returns the bottom or YMin value of the extent.
CELLSIZEX—Returns the cell size in the x-direction.
CELLSIZEY—Returns the cell size in the y-direction.
VALUETYPE—Returns the type of the cell value in the input raster.
COLUMNCOUNT—Returns the number of columns in the input raster.
ROWCOUNT—Returns the number of rows in the input raster.
BANDCOUNT—Returns the number of bands in the input raster.

bullet_item.para: The property returned will be displayed in the geoprocessing window.

scriptExample.title: GetRasterProperties example 1 (Python window)
scriptExample.para: This is a Python sample for GetRasterProperties
scriptExample.code: import arcpy from arcpy import env env.workspace = "c:/data" elevSTD = arcpy.GetRasterProperties_management("elevation", "STD")

scriptExample.title: GetRasterProperties example 2 (stand-alone script)
scriptExample.para: This is a Python script sample for GetRasterProperties
scriptExample.code: import arcpy from arcpy import env env.workspace = "c:/data" elevSTD = arcpy.GetRasterProperties_management("elevation", "STD")
